transcript:
too late. She was looking at them with an expression they both knew, an expression thoughtful and sad. This expres- sion in Princess Mary did not frighten them (she never inspired fear in anyone), but they knew that when it appeared on her face, she became mute and was not to be shaken in her determination. 
"You will change it, won't you?" said Lise. And as Princess Mary gave no answer, she left the room. 
Princess Mary was left alone. She did not comply with Lise's request, she not only lef
